FuncDef:
The ipv6 nd rs send rate-limit command sets a limit on the rate at which router solicitation (RS) messages are sent.
The undo ipv6 nd rs send rate-limit command restores the default rate limit. The ipv6 nd rs send rate-limit command sets a limit on the rate at which router solicitation (RS) messages are sent. The undo ipv6 nd rs send rate-limit command restores the default rate limit. The default rate limit for sending RS messages is 550 per second. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: undo ipv6 nd rs send rate-limit <rate-limit>
undo ipv6 nd rs send rate-limit

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a limit on the rate at which RS messages are sent.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1000, representing RS messages per second.

ExtraInfo: If the remote device has a limited capability of receiving RS messages, run the ipv6 nd rs send rate-limit command on the local device to set a limit on the rate at which RS messages are sent. This prevents the remote device from discarding RS messages due to its limited processing capability.
